1. I've tried with TaiPan and can't reproduce - it works fine with diagram and domain model in the same file.
2. The reason of the exception is that there is no diagram element in file generated by wizard.
3. Have you modified MidmapDiagramEditorUtil file? In particular 'createDiagram' method; it attaches diagram to resource.
No code was modified.  The mindmap examples are in CVS, so perhaps you can give them a try?  I can successfully reproduce by switching the gmfgen model property and regenerating.

The problem is that mindmap.ecore model declares DocumentRoot class. When resource is being created it contains two roots: Map (domain model) and Diagram (notation model). When resource is being loaded handler attempts to create DocumentRoot instance instead of Map and ignores Diagram at all if option XMLResource.OPTION_EXTENDED_META_DATA is set. In all cases except this one this option is ignored and so the DiagramRoot is. I've disabled the option too but it's not clear if this is a correct solution.
The DocumentRoot element will be present with all Ecore models derived from an XSD.

1. This is not RCP-specific, rigth?
2. Thread at news://news.eclipse.org/ep7pjc$cpn$1@utils.eclipse.org might eventually end up with support from EMF side for storing xsd-based models along with non xsd-based
Using the normal runtime generation options, the problem does not occur.  It only happens when using both RCP and same file for diagram/domain options.

Well, I meant it's just a coincidence a resource load option that reveals the problem is set only in RCP (URIDiagramDocumentProvider is generated for RCP only).  If the same option was set at e.g. GMFResourceFactory, the issue would be reproducible with full rt as well.

Created an attachment (id=64312)
TestCase for Mindmap XSD model within notation.Diagram resource

With EMF's bug #171996 fixed, we need to employ another approach to fixing this issue. I've updated DiagramEditorUtil to set extendedMetaData option on diagram resource in case when domain model is xsd-based and is not persisted in a separate file. This should neglect dependency on RECORD_UNKNOWN_FEATURE save option.

Attached is updated testcase from #171996 I use to verify the fix.

traces.message: Diagram is not present in resource
